meanings.definition: Not occurring or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The two trains had nonconcurrent schedules, so they never arrived together.
meanings.sent2: Her homework and her favorite TV show were nonconcurrent, so she had to choose one.
meanings.sent3: The nonconcurrent rain and sunshine made for a strange weather day.
meanings.sent4: Their nonconcurrent thoughts collided like ships passing in the night.
meanings.sent5: The nonconcurrent chirping of the birds created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Not meeting at the same point or in the same line.
meanings.sent1: The two roads were nonconcurrent, leading in different directions.
meanings.sent2: The nonconcurrent lines on the graph never intersected.
meanings.sent3: The nonconcurrent paths of the ants confused the observer.
meanings.sent4: Their nonconcurrent interests kept them apart.
meanings.sent5: The nonconcurrent shadows of the trees created a patchwork of light and dark.
